intro: Ononis pendula var. tetuanensis, commonly known as the Tetuan bentweed, is a perennial herb native to the Iberian Peninsula. It is characterized by its prostrate growth habit and slender, often hairy stems that trail along the ground. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers in clusters, typically blooming in early spring. Its leaves are opposite, linear to lanceolate, and covered in fine pubescence. This variety is adapted to rocky and dry habitats, showcasing its resilience in arid environments.
